document_data.name: Memory Read
document_data.mainbody: '''''Memory read''''' was a common [[divine]] [[spell]] that allowed the [[cleric]] to look into a creature's mind.
document_data.Effects:
The spell's target was a single creature, and it could be cast from a distance of {{SI|5'|'"|long=yes}}. When cast successfully, ''memory read'' let the caster and the target experience a specific memory with the same clarity and intensity as it was preserved in the target's mind. It took the cleric time equal to one-fifteenth of the actual event's length to read the memory. The spell worked well on sleeping or unconscious individuals, as well as those under the influence of ''[[Hold person|hold]]'' or ''[[paralyzation]]'' magic.

This spell could only affect creatures with intelligence greater than that of a beast, and the cast had to remain in close range or the duration of the reading. Even the sleeping target had a chance of resisting the ''memory read'' spell. The target could attempt to hide a memory or certain aspects from the cleric. The spell became more changing the older the target memory was.

''Memory read'' took a toll on the caster. Mental strain exerted during spellcasting affected the priest's constitution, and the caster was unable to re-cast the spell instill they received full eight hours of sleep or [[reverie]], restoring their health.

This spell was among those that could be cast by priests while underwater or by aquatic spellcasters.
document_data.Components: The spell required [[Verbal component|verbal]], [[somatic component|somatic]], and [[material component]]s components. The material component was a small piece of [[linen]] cloth with [[thread-of-gold]] strewn in. The spell consumed the material component once cast.

Notable Users.Organizations:
*[[Mazewalker]]s, the specialty clerics of [[Chultan]] deity [[Ubtao]], were granted the ability to ''memory read'' or use the spell of ''[[addition]]'' once per day.
*[[Tyr]]'s [[holy justice]]s were granted the ability to ''memory read'' after reaching a certain rank.
Notable Users.Individuals:
*[[Amaunator]]'s avatar had the ability to look into minds of criminals, in a way that closely resembled the ''memory read'' spell.

Notable Users.Other: *''[[Flame of the Spirit]]'', a holy artifact of the [[Tymoran]] faith. Occasionally, the goddess granted individuals who held the item access to spells, including ''memory read''.
